intro: Hieracium setigerum, commonly known as the devil's bit scabious, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, woodland edges, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its flowers are blue to purple in color, with ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers. Hieracium setigerum is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
